definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to have eyes bigger than one's belly (idiom)

sentences.english: The stretch the villagers have their eye on is also part of a concession.
sentences.chinese: 村民眼馋的林带也属于特许伐木区。

sentences.english: Not so cool, perhaps, but certainly very solid and with enviable revenue.
sentences.chinese: 虽然没那么酷了，但是非常健康，收入让人眼馋。

sentences.english: He often made the boss angry but let him take a lot of people envious of the seat.
sentences.chinese: 他常让上司恼火却总让他占着许多人眼馋的那个位子。

sentences.english: You'll love it and your fair-weather cycling buddies will be envious.
sentences.chinese: 你会爱上它和公平天气骑自行车的哥们眼馋。

sentences.english: I guess my eyes are bigger than my stomach.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得饭菜点得太多了，我是眼馋肚饱呀。

sentences.english: I always envied other children for their new clothes when I was a little child.
sentences.chinese: 小时候看人家穿新衣服就眼馋得慌。

definition: to water at the mouth/to drool
to drool (over) (idiom)/to yearn for/to covet/to crave
to drool with desire (idiom); to envy/to hunger for
lit. itchy heart/to be itching to do sth (idiom)
lit. to drool with desire (idiom)/fig. to hunger for/greedy
rare/uncommon/rarity/to value as a rarity/to cherish/Taiwan pr. [xi1 han3]
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
